description.narrative: Europe Beyond Access is an ambitious 4.8 year European multi partner disabilty arts programme designed to internationalise the careers of disabled artists and revolutionise Europe’s performing arts scene. The project is co-funded by Creative Europe. The core partners of the project are British Council (UK), Oriente Occidente (Italy), Onassis Stegi (Greece), Holland Dance Festival (The Netherlands), Kampnagel (Germany), Per.Art (Serbia), and Skånes Dansteater (Sweden). British Council is the lead partner.

The core objectives of Europe Beyond Access are to:
a) Contribute to artistic innovation of disabled artists in Europe b) Revolutionise the programming palette in European performing arts through showcasing world-class disability-led work and creating a network of experienced programmers interested in commissioning and presenting artists c) Increase interest in disability-led work d) Create the best possible industry conditions to source, develop, produce and present work of disabled artists"

"Showcasing of disabled artists:
- 10 new commissions of work by disabled artists and disability-led companies
- 4 new duets commissioned from international pairings of disabled and non-disabled artists
- 21 festivals or showcases of work by one or more artist / company …resulting in 472 participants developing, making, producing and presenting the works Artistic Innovation:
- 5 Transnational Artistic Laboratories with artists from all partner countries - 12 hosted residencies of overseas solo artists working with local artists - 8 hosted residencies of overseas groups or companies working with local artists - …resulting in 496 participants learning, testing, developing, listening and talking about artistic innovation
- 1 Artists’ Digital Exchange Programme actively engaging 150 artists - 1 Artistic Steering Committee of artistic managers formed to establish and raise expectations of the high-quality work of disabled artists working within the project and in the wider sector. For audiences:
- Audiences of over 70,000 exposed to innovative work of disabled artists and targeted by partners to become regular patrons. For the cultural sector:
- 913 cultural professionals and managers receiving training on taste development for mainstream audiences, developing disabled audiences and access, and understanding barriers faced by disabled audiences. - 2682 cultural professional and manager engaged with through Dissemination Affiliate events. - Almost 7000 cultural professionals and 330 organisations exposed to high-quality disability-led work. - 4 digital toolkits sharing best practice, distributed to 5600 artists and cultural professionals across Europe. - 15 Project e-newsletters.
disabled artists - cultural and creative professionals, general public/ audience.

participating-org.narrative: Associazione Incontri Internazionali Di Rovereto Oriente Occidente Teatro Danza Musica, IT

recipient-country.narrative: Poland 60%, UK 20%, Serbia, Greece, Italy, The Netherlands, Germany, Sweden (20% amongts these countries)
